alert.note: Alert for Gilchrist (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 21 at 2:14PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Florida and northern Florida, including the following areas, in northeast Florida, Eastern Putnam and Western Putnam. In northern Florida, Central Marion, Eastern Alachua, Eastern Marion, Gilchrist, Western Alachua and Western Marion. * WHEN...Through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The National Weather Service in Jacksonville has issued a Flood Watch for portions of northeast Florida and southeast Georgia. Heavy rainfall of 3 to 5 inches is possible, which may lead to flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
